title: How to Make Cookie Dough Dip

steps.headline: Cream the butter and cream cheese in a large bowl.
steps.description: With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the white sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract.
steps.description: Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the salt and chocolate chips.
steps.description: Blend once more until the cookie dough dip forms.

steps.headline: Add the milk or Greek yogurt.
steps.description: Mix until the dip has a thin consistency but is not liquid-like.

steps.headline: Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Cream the butter and both sugars in a large bowl.
steps.description: With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add in the salt and both extracts.
steps.description: Blend again until properly combined.

steps.headline: Stir in the flour and milk or yogurt, pouring it in slowly at a time.
steps.description: Blend on low speed, mixing until the cookie dough dip beings to form.

steps.headline: Fold in the chocolate chips and green food coloring.
steps.description: Mix until the cookie dough dip is a bright green color.

steps.headline: Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Cream the cream cheese, butter, and peanut butter in a large bowl.
steps.description: With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the powdered sugar and brown sugar.
steps.description: Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Slowly pour in the flour, adding small amounts at a time.
steps.description: Blend once again until the cookie dough dip begins to form.

steps.headline: Fold in the vanilla, M&Ms, oats, and chocolate chips.
steps.description: Blend until the ingredients are properly combined.

steps.headline: Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 425° Fahrenheit or 220° Celsius.
Cream the softened butter and both sugars in a large bowl.
steps.description: With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Slowly pour in the flour and salt, adding small amounts at a time.
steps.description: Blend once again until the cookie dough begins to turn crumbly.

steps.headline: Fold in the vanilla and milk.
steps.description: Blend until the ingredients are properly combined and soft.

steps.headline: Fold in the chocolate chips and mix until well-combined.
Spread the melted butter and graham crackers over a large iron skillet.
Press down the cookie dough onto the skillet.
Sprinkle the marshmallows all over the cookie dough.
steps.description: Add extra chocolate chips, if desired.

steps.headline: Bake the cookie dough dip in the oven for about 10-12 minutes.
steps.description: The chocolate will melt and the marshmallows will roast slightly and turn golden brown.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl.
steps.description: With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Pour in both extracts and blend again until well-combined.
Slowly pour in the flour and salt, adding small amounts at a time.
steps.description: Blend once again until the cookie dough dip begins to form. The mixture will be crumbly.

steps.headline: Stir in the milk and blend again.
steps.description: Mix until the dip is soft and properly combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the sprinkles and mix until folded in.
Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Cream the butter, peanut butter, and cream cheese in a large bowl.
steps.description: With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the powdered sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract.
steps.description: Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the chocolate chips and peanut butter chips.
Add the peanut butter candies and nuts.
steps.description: Blend until well-combined.

steps.headline: Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy!

steps.headline: In a food processor, blend the chickpeas, syrup, oat flour, and seed butter.
Add the vanilla, milk, and salt.
steps.description: Blend once more until the cookie dough dip forms.

steps.headline: Place the cookie dough dip in a large bowl and fold in the chocolate chips.
Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy!

text: Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Dip Cream the butter and cream cheese in a large bowl. With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Add the white sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix until well-combined. Fold in the salt and chocolate chips. Blend once more until the cookie dough dip forms. Add the milk or Greek yogurt. Mix until the dip has a thin consistency but is not liquid-like. Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.  Serve. Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy! Mint Cookie Dough Dip Cream the butter and both sugars in a large bowl. With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Add in the salt and both extracts. Blend again until properly combined. Stir in the flour and milk or yogurt, pouring it in slowly at a time. Blend on low speed, mixing until the cookie dough dip beings to form. Fold in the chocolate chips and green food coloring. Mix until the cookie dough dip is a bright green color. Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.  Serve. Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy! Monster Cookie Dough Dip Cream the cream cheese, butter, and peanut butter in a large bowl. With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Add the powdered sugar and brown sugar. Mix until well-combined. Slowly pour in the flour, adding small amounts at a time. Blend once again until the cookie dough dip begins to form. Fold in the vanilla, M&Ms, oats, and chocolate chips. Blend until the ingredients are properly combined. Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.  Serve. Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy! S'more Cookie Dough Dip Preheat the oven to 425° Fahrenheit or 220° Celsius.  Cream the softened butter and both sugars in a large bowl. With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Slowly pour in the flour and salt, adding small amounts at a time. Blend once again until the cookie dough begins to turn crumbly. Fold in the vanilla and milk. Blend until the ingredients are properly combined and soft. Fold in the chocolate chips and mix until well-combined.  Spread the melted butter and graham crackers over a large iron skillet.  Press down the cookie dough onto the skillet.  Sprinkle the marshmallows all over the cookie dough. Add extra chocolate chips, if desired. Bake the cookie dough dip in the oven for about 10-12 minutes. The chocolate will melt and the marshmallows will roast slightly and turn golden brown. Serve. Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy! Sugar Cookie Dough Dip Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl. With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Pour in both extracts and blend again until well-combined.  Slowly pour in the flour and salt, adding small amounts at a time. Blend once again until the cookie dough dip begins to form. The mixture will be crumbly. Stir in the milk and blend again. Mix until the dip is soft and properly combined. Fold in the sprinkles and mix until folded in.  Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.  Serve. Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy! Peanut Butter Cookie Dough Dip Cream the butter, peanut butter, and cream cheese in a large bowl. With an electric mixer, beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Add the powdered sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix until well-combined. Fold in the chocolate chips and peanut butter chips.  Add the peanut butter candies and nuts. Blend until well-combined. Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.  Serve. Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy! Vegan Cookie Dough Dip In a food processor, blend the chickpeas, syrup, oat flour, and seed butter.  Add the vanilla, milk, and salt. Blend once more until the cookie dough dip forms. Place the cookie dough dip in a large bowl and fold in the chocolate chips.  Allow the cookie dough dip to chill in the fridge for about an hour.  Serve. Place the bowl of cookie dough dip on a large plate. Place sliced fruit, small cookies, graham crackers, or pretzels on the side for dipping. Enjoy!
